channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.3% To 98.10
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index fell 0.3% to 98.10 — snapping a five-trading-day winning streak.

item.title: Visa Wanted a Vast Empire. First, It Had to Beat Back Its Foes.
item.description: By wooing partners and strong-arming competitors, Visa sits atop the payments world and in the sights of the Justice Department.

item.title: The Score: Netflix, Morgan Stanley, TSMC and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: Weight-loss drugs may reduce opioid and alcohol abuse by up to 50%, study finds
item.description: Weight-loss drugs such as Ozempic, made by Denmark’s Novo Nordisk, can reduce rates of opioid and alcohol abuse by up to 50%, according to a new study...

item.title: It's Time to Bring 401(k)s Into the 21st Century
item.description: The retirement savings plans don’t fit the increasingly mobile workforce of today. There’s an easy way to fix that.

item.title: Why Do Health Insurers Keep Getting Slammed With Higher Costs?
item.description: Investors are fleeing the sector as health insurers are repeatedly surprised by rising healthcare costs.

item.title: The U.S. economy’s biggest threat? China’s clean-energy push.
item.description: As China ramps up its renewable-energy production, the U.S. risks becoming dependent on outdated energy sources.

item.title: The stock market still leans to this candidate winning the presidential election
item.description: The Dow’s indication of who will win the U.S. presidency deserves to be taken seriously.

item.title: A lot of your personal wealth is tied up in your employer. How to spread out the risk.
item.description: Direct indexing and individualized portfolios can help an investor avoid overexposure to an employer’s stock

item.title: Big Fed rate cut was justified, but it may have acted politically, Trump economic adviser says
item.description: Kevin Hassett, who was Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers in the Trump administration from 2017 to 2019, agreed with Trump’s view that the F...
